Platform strategy

Choose the stack that helps your website grow

We recommend platforms based on your context: how fast you need to launch, who manages content, and how your website supports revenue.

What we optimize for

  • Faster launch with fewer operational headaches.
  • Strong performance for users and search visibility.
  • Reliable scaling as traffic and business demand grow.
  • A setup your team can actually manage long term.

Our main recommendations

Kinsta for WordPress businesses

Best when your website runs on WordPress and downtime or slow pages affect leads and sales. It gives solid performance, predictable operations, and a support model built for WordPress teams.

Cloudflare for general websites

We use it as a performance and protection layer for almost any public website. It helps keep your site fast, stable, and safer under real traffic.

Framer for speed in campaigns and launches

Great for teams that need to publish fast, iterate messaging quickly, and ship high-impact pages without a long production cycle.

Webflow for content-driven marketing teams

Ideal when your team needs autonomy to update content, publish new pages, and keep brand quality consistent without depending on development for every change.

Supporting options by scenario

  • Cloudways for managed hosting with balanced cost and flexibility.
  • DigitalOcean for custom products that need deeper control.
  • Netlify or Vercel for modern front-end workflows and fast iteration.

Quick decision guide

Business need Recommended setup Why it fits
Commercial WordPress site Kinsta Reliable performance and smooth day-to-day management.
General business website Cloudflare layer Better speed, stronger resilience, and safer delivery.
Launch and campaign pages Framer Fast publishing and quick message iteration.
Brand site with frequent content updates Webflow Team autonomy with high visual control.
